review: Works well on my older HD TV (it has an HDMI input); great picture, better than from a DVD.Easy to setup and the remote functions well.  I would prefer a On/Off switch so I could more easily change from Fire to regular broadcast TV.  Search feature works well if you know a name; browsing is harder since there are few filters.
author: Mark Whittaker

review: The system works fine, it just may not be for me.  I have no idea what I want to watch regularly and to just watch something takes too many steps to get to something.  The shows I want to watch are not available unless through another service (Hulu, Sling, etc.)  But even then could get sling to work, continues to tell me network connection issues, though everything else works fine. I have not found this to be a good option to change from cable/satellite.  I can not stream from the internet or from my computer.  I can stream the local news channel on my computer, but can not even stream that on this device.
author: bstager

review: I own both the Roku 3 and the Fire tv, fire tv is overal a faster device, but not all apps work as fast on all devices, for example the app Watch Espn and Sports Illustrated work much faster on the Roku 3.Overall The device is of good quality and very responsive.
author: GinoW

review: Overall excellent. I mostly view Netflix and included movies. I enjoy not having to endure commercials. In fact I think my attitude is that if Im paying for entertainment I wont put up with commercials at all. For instance I tried Hulu and found it too much like cable tv. If you had the golf and tennis channels it would be perfect.Don MayberryPensacola
author: Don Mayberry

review: I love my Fire TV!!! I can catch all my shows and see great movies. My kids love to see the games on the big screen! I guess I will invest in the remote control next for the games. Overall I love it!

We would like to see more viewing sources added to this,; probably should have purchased the Roku 3 instead. The price is the same, and Roku gives more options.
